name: Rava Dosa
history: Rava Dosa, a variant of the popular South Indian dosa, is made using semolina (rava) and is known for its crispy texture. Unlike traditional dosa, it doesn't require fermentation.
description: Rava Dosa is a thin, crispy, and lacy crepe made from a batter of semolina, rice flour, and all-purpose flour. It's often flavored with spices and herbs, making it a delightful treat.

equipment.name: ladle
equipment.description: Used for pouring the batter onto the skillet.

equipment.name: spatula
equipment.description: Used for flipping and removing the dosa.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine semolina, rice flour, all-purpose flour, cumin seeds, black pepper, curry leaves, and salt. Add water gradually to form a batter of pouring consistency. Let it rest for 10 minutes.

instructions.title: Add Vegetables
instructions.description: Stir in the chopped onions and green chili into the batter.

instructions.title: Cook the Rava Dosa
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick skillet. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it evenly to form a thin pancake. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until the dosa is golden and crisp. Flip and cook for another minute.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Rava Dosa hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

tips: The batter should be thin and of pouring consistency for crispy dosas.
Cook on a medium-high flame for the best texture.
variations: Add grated carrots or finely chopped coriander for a different flavor.
Experiment with various toppings like paneer or cheese.

storage.shelfLife: Rava Dosa batter can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat dosas on a skillet until crisp.
presentationTips: Serve on a banana leaf with a side of assorted chutneys for an authentic experience.
